detaileddescription.para: Note that wxFont currently does not make distinctions between wxFONTFAMILY_MODERN and wxFONTFAMILY_TELETYPE.

monospaced) font. Monospace fonts have a fixed width like typewriters and often have strong angular or block serifs. Monospace font faces are often used code samples and have a simple, functional font style. See also wxFont::IsFixedWidth() for an easy way to test for monospace property.

briefdescription.para: Invalid font family value, returned by wxFont::GetFamily() when the font is invalid for example.
Standard font families: these are used mainly during wxFont creation to specify the generic properties of the font without hardcoding in the sources a specific face name.

detaileddescription.para: wxFontFamily thus allows to group the font face names of fonts with similar properties. Most wxWidgets ports use lists of fonts for each font family inspired by the data taken from http://www.codestyle.org/css/font-family.

briefdescription.para: The font is drawn without slant.
The font is slanted in an italic style.
The font is slanted, but in a roman style.

detaileddescription.para: Note that under wxMSW this style is the same as wxFONTSTYLE_ITALIC.
The elements of this enum correspond to CSS absolute size specifications, see http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/fonts.html#font-size-props

briefdescription.para: no special flags: font with default weight/slant/anti-aliasing
anti-aliasing flag: force on or off (default: the current system default)
Strike-through style (only supported in wxMSW and wxGTK currently).

enumvalue.name: wxFONTFLAG_MASK
enumvalue.initializer: wxFONTFLAG_ITALIC | wxFONTFLAG_SLANT | wxFONTFLAG_LIGHT | wxFONTFLAG_BOLD | wxFONTFLAG_ANTIALIASED | wxFONTFLAG_NOT_ANTIALIASED | wxFONTFLAG_UNDERLINED | wxFONTFLAG_STRIKETHROUGH

briefdescription.para: the mask of all currently used flags
The font flag bits for the new font ctor accepting one combined flags word.
doesn't exist currently, but put it here anyhow to make all ISO8859 consecutive numbers
Alias for the native Unicode encoding on this platform (this is used by wxEncodingConverter and wxUTFFile only for now)
A font using the wxFONTFAMILY_SWISS family and 2 points smaller than wxNORMAL_FONT.
A font using the wxFONTFAMILY_ROMAN family and wxFONTSTYLE_ITALIC style and of the same size of wxNORMAL_FONT.
A font identic to wxNORMAL_FONT except for the family used which is wxFONTFAMILY_SWISS.
Converts string to a wxFont best represented by the given string.
Converts the given wxFont into a string.
